intro: Scleranthus polychaitos, commonly known as the pale sand-rocket, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, yellow flowers and slender, branching stems. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its leaves are linear and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. Scleranthus polychaitos is an annual plant that thrives in full sun and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
